tutorial.title: Finish the TOYS'R'U Home Page
tutorial.descriptionContent: Finish building the TOYS'R'U home page by fixing some errors and completing the content

executableContent.instructions:
A new company, TOYS'R'U, wants to develop a new website. Here's what the basic site is supposed to look like.

The store owner started building this site but then realized they needed a little help.  Let's take care of a few issues before we start adding the remaining content.

1. For the existing "About Us" link opening `<a>` tag, add the missing attribute that allows you to specify the link's URL. 
2. Fix the "Jobs" element so that it is structured just like the "About Us" link.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
TOYS'R'U!

Welcome to TOYS'R'U, where all you need is your imagination!

About Us Jobs

Click the link above to start designing your new toy!
files.solvedContent:
TOYS'R'U!

Welcome to TOYS'R'U, where all you need is your imagination!

About Us Jobs

Click the link above to start designing your new toy!

executableContent.instructions:
Now let's add a new link to our navigation. 

1. Before the "Jobs" link, add a third link with `Privacy` as the content and an `href` attribute with no URL set.

executableContent.instructions:
Since our links are actually related items, let's structure them as a list. An unordered list is a bulleted list of items. They are created using the `
    ` tag and list items within the unordered list are created using the `
  • ` tag. Nest each link `` within it's own `
  • ` element. Don't forget to end your list with the closing `
` tag. 1. Under the first `p` , create an unordered list with three list items, one for each of our three navigation links. 2. Place each of the `About Us` , `Privacy` , and `Jobs` link elements inside each of the three list items.

executableContent.instructions:
Now let's create a new link after the list element so our visitors can access the new toy designer.

1. Create a new link containing the text `Design a New Toy`.
2. Add the `href` attribute with no URL set.
3. Make the text for this link important.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: You should use `<strong>` to bold text that is important.

executableContent.instructions:
Now let's add some of the missing content below our new toy link and paragraph text.

1. Under the second paragraph, create a second-level heading with the text `Best Sellers`.
2. Under the heading, create an ordered list with three list items.
3. Create a link within each list item, with the text set to the name of a toy (e.g., Bouncy Ball).

files.name: index.html
files.content:
TOYS'R'U!

Welcome to TOYS'R'U, where all you need is your imagination!

  • About Us
  • Privacy
  • Jobs
Design a New Toy

Click the link above to start designing your new toy!

TOYS'R'U!

Welcome to TOYS'R'U, where all you need is your imagination!

  • About Us
  • Privacy
  • Jobs
Design a New Toy

Click the link above to start designing your new toy!

Best Sellers

  1. Bouncy Ball
  2. Pogo Stick
  3. Yo-yo

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
An ordered list is a numbered list of items. They are created using the `<ol>` tag and list items within the ordered list are created using the `<li>` tag.  

Your code should be structured like this:

```HTML
<heading 2>Best Sellers</heading 2>
    <ordered list>
      <list item>link for toy #1</list item>
      <list item>link for toy #2</list item>
      <list item>link for toy #3</list item>
    </ordered list>
```

executableContent.instructions:
Finally, let's add a footer to complete our page. 1. Add a `
` element before our closing body tag. 2. Add the company name `TOYS'R'U` in a `

` tag in the footer. 3. Add a link *inside* the `p` element with the text `Email us` and set the `href` attribute to `mailto:nobody@mimo.org`. Then close the tags accordingly.
